title: all:initial
body: Supported by Firefox and Chrome and gives the developer more control over CSS cascading. This would be helpful when when writing components that get inserted in other environments.

comments.body: Any updates? All browsers including Safari now support this feature. It is very useful for widgets and components.
Looks like direct links to features have been fixed in a moment, or they accidentally either work or not, depending on distribution of stars.
HTTP URLs of modern.ie and dev.modern.ie now redirect to https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/ while HTTPS versions of the same URls apparently indeed donâ€™t work.
The currently Safari-only 'revert' value makes this far more useful. It'd be great to see this in Edge and hopefully others will follow suit.
Microsoft browsers are now the only ones that do not support this.
The statement "Not Supported in Safari" is wrong in https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/status/cssallshorthand/
How the **** this is not supported in 2017 is beyond me.
all: revert would be even better!
There is also the `revert` value in the newer level of the spec (https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade/#default), that is already supported by Safari. Maybe it should also be implemented?
